page.title: 03Historic Sites
page.content: {Maumbury Rings}is on the Southern outskirts of Dorchester. The Earth Works were constructed in the Late Neolithic Period. After A.D.43, it was used as a Roman Amphitheatre. In 1685, Judge Jeffreys hanged here some of the rebels from the Monmouth Rebellion. Now it is used as a public walking area and a tourist site. On the Northern side of the Broadmayne road traces have been found of a Neolithic circular{Woodhenge,}with an area of 4 - 5 hectares, enclosed by a bank and a ditch .It is thought to have been larger and more important than Stonehenge. Beside the river are the sites of {two ancient lost villages}and a church (St.German's). One village was called Winterborne Farringdon. There are twelve{Tumuli}in the area.
